body:
Internal Release Notes

Good news!

This release contains exciting enhancements for Healthcare Intelligence!
Healthcare Intelligence: Rates Analyzer
Results: Geography Tab
  • Now when comparing two reporting plan groups, users can quickly and easily understand which one has the lower median rate. The geographic areas on the map will be colored according to reporting plan group with the lower median rate. A shade of purple indicates that the primary reporting plan group has a lower median rate, and a shade of blue indicates that the comparison reporting plan group has a lower median rate.
    • When the user is analyzing only the primary reporting plan group, all areas on the map will be highlighted in purple.
    • When the user is analyzing a primary and a comparison reporting plan group and there are results for only one group, then the area will be shaded for the group which has results.
Specialties Tab:
  • Now, graph and table will display the specialty and specialty classification instead of the specialty and NUCC code.
  • In the Rates Boxplot view, labels within the tooltip on the graph now match the column titles in the table.
Reporting Plan Groups: Add New Group
  • The Plan IDs Name column is renamed to be “Company Name”
  • Now, the Plan IDs have been updated.
Administration
  • Updated the placeholder text in the rate source field to state “Select Rate Source(s) for Healthcare Intelligence analysis.”

Fixed Issues:

Healthcare Intelligence: Rates Analyzer
  • Geography tab: Now, the map consistently renders correctly.
Manage Users
  • Now, inactive Healthcare Intelligence users do not require access to a project to be reactivated.
